Headline: Reading systems. Designing what holds.
Comment:
I like the focus on time as the real competition. It‚Äôs a reminder that consumer trust compounds slowly, not in viral spikes.

I wish more founders respected the operating system of India - a value-conscious, multi-generational consumer mindset that rewards brands offering consistency over gimmicks.

I wonder how many brands fail because they chase tech startup growth curves, ignoring that FMCG and consumer brands are built through distribution depth, repeatable quality, and ritual adoption.

Insight: 
In India, brands aren‚Äôt built, they‚Äôre earned - over decades, not quarters.

#IamAcculian
#IamCalm

Comment:
I completely agree with your perspective Rishabh. Building a lasting consumer brand in India requires patience, trust, and a long-term vision. It‚Äôs not just about rapid short-term growth but about establishing deep-rooted value in a highly competitive market.

I wish more investors recognized this difference and supported brands with the patience and belief needed to sustain for decades. Distribution, word-of-mouth, quality, and strong product-market fit take years to develop, and brands need the right investment partners who share their vision beyond just short-term metrics.

Headline: Building brands from the ground up!
Comment:
Rishabh Mariwala , your post on the patience required to build consumer brands in India‚Äîunlike the rapid scaling possible in tech‚Äîraises an important question: ùóóùóºùó≤ùòÄ ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùòÅùóøùóÆùó±ùó∂ùòÅùó∂ùóºùóªùóÆùóπ ùó©ùóñ ùó∫ùóºùó±ùó≤ùóπ ùòÅùóøùòÇùóπùòÜ ùóÆùóπùó∂ùó¥ùóª ùòÑùó∂ùòÅùóµ ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùòÅùóøùóÆùó∑ùó≤ùó∞ùòÅùóºùóøùòÜ ùóºùó≥ ùó∞ùóºùóªùòÄùòÇùó∫ùó≤ùóø ùóØùóøùóÆùóªùó±ùòÄ?¬†¬†

As you  rightly pointed out - Tech startups scale fast, leveraging network effects & capital efficiency, making them ideal for venture-style returns. But in consumer brands, trust takes time. Distribution, word-of-mouth and habit formation don‚Äôt happen overnight. The payoff is often significant but slow‚Äîsometimes beyond the typical 7‚Äì10 year VC exit cycle.

So, is brand-building truly venture investible? Or does the return cycle required for VCs fundamentally mismatch the growth arc of a consumer brand?            

Would love to hear your perspective on navigating this intersection between capital velocity & brand-building patience.
processed_comment: rishabh mariwala your post on the patience required to build consumer brands in indiaunlike the rapid scaling possible in techraises an important question as you rightly pointed out tech startups scale fast leveraging network effects capital efficiency making them ideal for venturestyle returns but in consumer brands trust takes time distribution wordofmouth and habit formation dont happen overnight the payoff is often significant but slowsometimes beyond the typical year vc exit cycle so is brandbuilding truly venture investible or does the return cycle required for vcs fundamentally mismatch the growth arc of a consumer brand would love to hear your perspective on navigating this intersection between capital velocity brandbuilding patience
